security_audit.summary: This is a documentation-only skill containing a SKILL.md file with guidance for generating API endpoint code. No executable code, no file system access beyond reading its own file, no network calls, and no command execution capabilities. Pure prompt-based skill with zero attack surface.

content.user_title: Add HTTP endpoints to Catalyst-Relay server
content.value_statement: Need to add new API routes to your Catalyst-Relay server but unsure of the proper pattern? This skill provides the complete template for creating endpoints with Zod validation, consistent response formats, and proper documentation.
actual_capabilities: Create route files with colocated Zod schemas and response types
Implement handler functions using Hono framework factory pattern
Wire routes to the Hono app in the routes index
Generate API documentation with request/response examples
Map HTTP endpoints to library methods on ADTClient
limitations: Cannot connect to SAP ADT servers directly
Does not validate generated code compiles

prompt_templates.title: Create simple endpoint
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a new endpoint at src/server/routes/health/check.ts that returns server status with uptime and memory usage

prompt_templates.title: Add POST endpoint
prompt_templates.prompt: Add a POST endpoint at src/server/routes/users/search.ts that accepts search filters and returns matching user records

prompt_templates.title: Create CRUD operations
prompt_templates.prompt: Create full CRUD endpoints for managing transport requests at src/server/routes/transports/ with create, read, update, and delete operations

prompt_templates.title: Wire route to app
prompt_templates.prompt: Register the new /transports/create endpoint in src/server/routes/index.ts with session authentication middleware

output_examples.input: Create a POST endpoint for previewing data at src/server/routes/preview/data.ts
output: Created route file with Zod schema for request validation
Added DataPreviewResponse interface for typed responses
Used consistent success/error envelope with literal types

best_practices: Use the factory pattern: export a handler function that accepts dependencies
Place request schema and response types in the same file for co-location
Use as const for success/false literals to preserve discriminated union types
Document endpoints in docs/endpoints/ following the required structure
anti_patterns: Avoid putting multiple handlers in a single file
Do not skip Zod schema validation for request bodies
Never hardcode error codes - use the error envelope pattern
Do not forget to wire the route in src/server/routes/index.ts

faq.question: Where should new route files be created?
faq.answer: Create route files in src/server/routes/{category}/{endpoint}.ts, e.g., auth/login.ts or preview/data.ts

faq.question: What validation library is used?
faq.answer: Zod is used for request validation with safeParse() for type-safe parsing and error handling

faq.question: How are routes registered?
faq.answer: Routes are registered in src/server/routes/index.ts using app.post(), app.get(), etc. with the handler factory

faq.question: Is authentication required for endpoints?
faq.answer: Endpoints receive sessionManager via the factory pattern. Auth requirements depend on route configuration

faq.question: What response format is required?
faq.answer: Use { success: true|false as const, data?: result, error?: message, code?: string } envelope with HTTP status codes

faq.question: How does this differ from Express or Fastify?
faq.answer: Catalyst-Relay uses Hono, a lightweight web framework with built-in TypeScript support and middleware composition
